results.title: Power and the land
results.creator_credit: United States. Film Service, United States. Dept. of Agriculture and Joris Ivens
results.brief_description: Sensitive portrayal of American ideals and lifestyles, made to explain and promote the Department of Agriculture’s program of rural electrification. Filmed on the farm of Bill and Hazel Parkinson in St. Clairsville, Ohio, capturing the hardship of a nonelectrified farm and the progress and profit brought by electricity. The film is critical of the reluctance by public utility companies to install power to rural areas. A significant documentary that elevates the status of farmers and the value of their work. Cinematography, Floyd Crosby and Arthur Ornitz. Script, Edwin Locke. Editing, Helen van Dongen. Commentary by Stephen Vincent Benet. Music, Douglas Moore.

results.title: Power and terror: Noam Chomsky in our times
results.brief_description: A series of lectures by eminent American expert on foreign policy, Noam Chomsky, are centred around the issues of September 11 - the United States’ response to the disaster, as well as the Government’s participation in terrorism. Chomsky displays his signature articulation and intelligence in these illuminating pieces, providing a complex picture of world politics. He deftly places the terrorist attacks in the context of American foreign intervention throughout the decades: for example in Vietnam, Central America and the Middle East. In stark and uncompromising terms Chomsky presents his views that challenge widely held perceptions about America’s motivations, in a refreshingly composed and astute way. Some lectures include question and answer forums with the audience.

results.title: Power and glory
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Ron Johnston and Antelope Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Testament: The Bible and history”.
Virtually the sole source of learning in the western Dark Ages, the Bible’s character’s and stories were used to justify the social order and to offer its citizens security in this world and the next. After the fall of the Roman Empire, Christianity was nurtured in small settlements places like Ireland and Scotland. From these monastries came the most beautiful illuminated manuscripts of Bible text. Charlemagne restored Christianity to its glory and feudal society mirrored that of the Bible with its emphasis on order and place. Also features a close look at the ancient Byzantine church of Haiga Sophia in Istanbul.

results.title: Power and corruption
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This specially edited version of Polanski’s “Macbeth” focuses on the dramatic chain of events precipitated by Macbeth’s killing of Duncan, his king. One of the results of the sinister murder is that Macbeth is crowned King of Scotland in an impressive ceremony at Scone. The other fruits of his action, however, are bitter, for Macbeth has to learn that power illegally gained corrupts no one so much as him who gets it.

results.title: Power among men
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information, Julien Bryan and Thorold Dickinson
results.brief_description: This is the first feature-length film to deal with the idea and purposes of the UN. It is a film about two forces which co-exist in humankind; power to build and power to destroy. Man prides himself on being the builder of civilisations. He cannot deny that he is an equally effective destroyer. The film leaves the viewer with the knowledge that it is up to man himself to make the choice. In sequences filmed in Italy, Haiti, Norway and Canada the film shows how man’s abilities have been put to use and how his powers have been applied. The positive need for human beings to find lasting solutions to the problems of controlling their destructive power is dramatically illustrated.

results.title: Power
results.brief_description: Power system in automobiles. Cylinder; piston operation; 4-cycle action of intake, compression, power and exhaust; differences between 1, 4 and 6 cylinder engines; power turning the wheels. Animated diagrams assist the explanations.

results.title: Powder
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Caravan Pictures, Roger Birnbaum, Daniel Grodnik and Victor Salva
results.brief_description: A sci-fi film about a 16-year-old albino boy who, having spent all his life living in his grandparents basement until their passing away, suddenly finds himself in a totally foreign environment when he is removed from his home and placed into school. Jeremy Reed (Sean Patrick Flanery) nick-named Powder, has special powers but his strange physical appearance and behaviour causes division within the school and the community with bigotry and hatred on one side and respect and friendship on the other. An unusual modern day fable. Cast includes Mary Steenburgen, Lance Henriksen, Jeff Goldblum.
